security: Disclosing the CIA's monitoring of individuals like Dale Smith and their activities, especially in relation to groups like Black Power, could be considered sensitive. The document includes a request to transkit a reply via liaison, which may expose intelligence-gathering methods and relationships with foreign entities. Quoting directly: 'Attached is a newspaper interview with American Black Power advocate Dale SMITH...which gives a fair description of SMITH's views...'
summary: A CIA memorandum regarding the activities of Dale Smith, a Black Power advocate, including a newspaper interview he gave in Denmark and a related television program.
summary_one_paragraph: This SECRET CIA memorandum, dated September 20, 1968, from CI/Ober to the FBI, concerns the activities of Dale Smith, an American Black Power advocate. It includes an attached newspaper interview with Smith published in SÃ¸ndags Aktuelt, Denmark, and references a Danish television program featuring a group of American Negroes criticizing white American capitalism, Russian communism, and Denmark. The memo requests a reply via liaison, Mr. S.J. Papich, and is disseminated to various CIA divisions including E/SC/CE, GIRA, CELSN, and RID, with copies sent to Dale Smith (201) and PROD COPENHAGEN.
title: Activities of Dale SMITH
